reviews.review_msg: I thought he was intimidating at the beginning but as the term progressed, I realised he was the professor who most cared about his students' wellbeing. Such a caring professor and great at giving lectures. When things seemed unfair, he would actually listen and change them. I also loved that he brought in experts to present topics/opportunities.
Many readings and materials to memorize but an interesting course. The midterms and exam were multiple choice format. Exam covered most information from lecture and textbook and were straightforward

Tbh, I expected this class to be excellent considering the high ratings but in my opinion I found this class super unfair. All his exams are in person but on a laptop, where people can easily cheat, which is unfair to people who actually studied. There is also ALOT of textbook readings, more than psyc classes. However, exam is fair if you studied.
one of the best profs at sfu

took hsci 120 with prof salters and she was awesome. her grading scheme was well-planned and didn't rely heavily on the exams which i prefer. the TA marks fairly difficult for it being a first-year class so i would definitely spend more time towards the papers. the exams are fair and if you put in the work, you will get a great mark.

Everyone needs to take HSCI 120 with Dr. Salters, no matter what faculty you are in. Coming from a non-health science major, this is truly one of the best classes I have taken at SFU and Dr. Salters is such an inspirational individual. You won't regret taking a course with her!

Dr. Salters is the most accomodating prof I've ever had. She teaches clearly and cares about her students. She extended our paper deadline and even cut class short to help us finish it. I HIGHLY recommend her, she is genuinely the best prof I've ever had. The exam wasn't hard, just make sure you read the textbook. Take her class!!

Dr. Salters is such a gem of a prof. The lectures are a bit long but really interesting. I really did learn ALOT from this course, even aside from the learning objectives. The questions on her exams are fair game if you just attend the lectures and listen to what she's saying. TAKE HER CLASS.

She's one of the best professors at SFU so far! She's really engaging and her course content is definitely interesting. There's a clear grading rubric for each assignment and as long as you meet it you can expect a good mark! The midterm exam was all MC and not too complicated as long as you studied.

Great prof, personally enjoyed the content, learned a lot. Great prof IMO, most people don't attend lectures, but IMO it's important to go as she gives lots of hints and tips for assignments/exams. Make sure to read textbook material along with notes, and an A is quite achievable. Assignments are short papers, didn't spend too much time.

Super nice & woke! Topics are really interesting & extremely important to learn about! 2 all-scantron exams & 3 super short papers. Readings are more supplementary than necessary. Lectures rarely go all 3 hours. That said, guest lecturers suck, TAs have crazy hit-or-miss grading styles, & HSCI classes are curved! So NOT a bird course / GPA-booster!

Dr. Salters is an incredible lecturer! Well informed and highly passionate about what she teaches. Lectures were super organized, engaging and informative! Definitely recommend HSCI 120 with her - very applicable to life. She's in it for her students as she is super approachable. Amazing prof!

Kate makes HSCI 120 a very fun class. She breaks down a lot of the textbook material so it's easy to grasp and she is clear on what she expects in terms of the two assignments. She's very approachable. You'll do well on her exams as long as you study her slides and maybe go over the textbook once or twice. Definitely recommend as a GPA booster!

HSCI 120 with Kate Salters is not only an interesting course, but easy to succeed in too. If you follow her assignment rubrics, you will get a good grade. She makes what she requires very clear. Her exams are fair and final is cumulative but still has more weight on the 2nd half of the course. Would definitely recommend this course as a GPA booster

kate is a great prof, shes very knowledgeable and isnt the hardest marker. Definitely study the lecture slides for the exams. I wouldnt constantly skip this class but if you miss a couple it wont affect you
Kate was a great professor, the course wasn't too hard. If you show up to lectures, listen, take good notes and read the textbook you'll do well.
she alright. it was an easy class but i didn't focus so much. I didn't study that much for this class yet still got a decent mark. here exams are straight forward. pre simple

Dr. Salters was a very engaging and fair prof. She clearly outlined what would be in our midterms and finals, as well as provided clear grading for our projects. HSCI 120 was such an interesting class to take with her she is so educated on the subject and really inspires students to learn more. Both projects were fun to do and helped me learn a lot

Great prof overall. This course contained 2 projects and a midterm and final, all were fair and fairly marked. Textbook is necessary if you want a high grade as she tests some details from there that aren't in the lecture slides. The class was very manageable and if anyone ever needs clarification with anything she is responsive over emails as well

Kate is very passionate about sexual health and what she teaches in this course. Every topic is interesting and informative which makes studying way easier. Study off her slides and go to lecture because midterm and final will include some info from discussions/videos in class. Project and short blog post were fun to do. Put in effort to do well.
Dr. Salters is a very friendly and engaging instructor. Class was always interesting. Assignments and examinations were very fair. Don't buy the textbook and remember to attend every lecture.

This class was a bop. Kate is awesome and keeps lectures interesting. Fairly easy class, don't bother reading the textbook but definitely go to class cuz she likes to give out sneaky tidbits of testable info when few people go to lecture that day.

there is one midterm, a final, a project and paper. it's easy as long as you put a little work in and show up. attendance isnt recorded but she will say things during lecture that can be tested on. the prof is super engaging and nice. easy GPA boost, and interesting lectures.

Kate is a good professor and I enjoyed her class. DO NOT BOTHER BUYING THE TEXTBOOK, I didn't open it once. This course takes a bit of memorization so put aside some time to study, but considering you don't have to do the reading it's not so bad. The course was interesting and fun but I wish there was a bit of discussion on gender inequality in sex
Kate is an incredibly well prepared and passionate professor. The content was thoroughly explained and relevant to everyday life. I wish there were more classes like this!
Amazing class. Very informative and Kate teaches material very well. If you read the suggested textbook readings and attend lectures, you will do well.

Pay attention to her lecture that is for sure to save you time from reading the textbook. Her midterm and final also tests you that is mentioned in lecture but not on lecture slides nor textbook. Not bad of a teacher. I would not say it is a GPA booster.

Lovely gal with a lot of high passion in what she's teaching.  She is very clear in what she says and also what she asks from the students. HSCI120 is a class that every single student should take, as it spreads knowledge that is essential for a better community and a safer society.

Highly recommend this course with this prof. She is amazing. Not totally nesicarry to read the textbook as she goes over all of it in lecture. She will tell you what you need to study. Two short papers and discussions online for participation. No need to even go to class, she is a great prof and it's a great and informative course!

I took Kate's sex-ed course, and really enjoyed it. She is a great prof, is able to answer any question and encourages students to ask for clarification where needed. All the lecture slides were posted online which made it easier to follow along in class, but sometimes it felt like she was reading right from them. Lectures were long but worth it.

Kate is awesome. Very passionate, clear, helpful and her lectures are engaging. Her exams are extremely fair - the only problem I had with the course was the group project so be prepared for that. Overall loved her and the course and it's one of those where you'll carry what you learned throughout my life. A+ and definitely recommend!

Kate is wonderful, I really enjoyed her class. Midterms and exams are based on lectures but make sure you read the textbook as well! Read through each chapter once. There was also online discussions (you have to do 5), a group project, and a media critique - super easy! Attend the lectures because sometimes the exams include stuff from lectures.

Interesting class, but I did not like the way Kate taught it. Everything was 100% memorization based, and marking was very inconsistent. The TA was absolutely horrible too, had no idea what he was talking about, but acted like he knew everything.
great prof.
She's a great professor but not interesting at all. Lectures were dry.

Go to lecture because a handful of  exam question will be from things mentioned in lecture and which are not on the powerpoint. I took this course straight outta high school I just felt like it was just a watered down version of things I already learned and have done research on.
good prof

Kate is absolutely AMAZING.VERY FAIR.She is extremely helpful and goes out of her way to help her students succeed. The lecture slides are online but go to the lectures because some of her exam questions are from things she talks about.Only 1 essay+easy online discussion questions every week(only need 5).If you can take hsci120 with her, go for it!
She's amazing. If you have a chance to take HSCI 120 with her, hop on it. Life changing.
She was awesome! Super nice and understanding. She made class interesting and enjoyable :) Also, her exams are fair -- basically everything she mentions in class, readings, etc.

EXTREMLY HELPFULL, make sure to attend all classes.goes out of her way to help students.hands down the best prof i have ever had at SFU. class material is interesting her lectures are engaging and organized.and her exams are based on everything she talks about in class so go to class and take down notes. wish she taught every single class

Really tries really hard to make the material interesting. Posts slides, videos and articles online. Uses in-class assignments to ensure attendance. Exams are straight forward if you attend class and do the readings. She is very good at accommodating multiple perspectives and has a high interest in the class.
Recommend this class to any one.
Very nice and clear. Had guest speakers coming in that really consist with lecture material. Participation is a must!
The 2 MT's are considered tough for a 100 level class. Final was much easier. MUST read the book, and know all definitions. Very informative class, nonetheless.

my favourite prof ever!!! she is soo awesome and the class is really interesting and will help you out in life. MUST take this class!!! carolyn is the best prof ever! in class, it just feels like your talking about sex with your best friend. thats how cool she is
MUST TAKE CLASS
Fun lecture!!! But class attendance is compulsory... Attendance is taken by writing in class essay. Exam materials are tested too many minor details ...:( awesome prof still!!!!!

Carolyn was great! She kept lectures very interesting with lots of videos and funny examples. Attending her class is a must because anything is examinable, especially since she has guest lecturers too. There wasn't one paper for this class, but several 5-minute essays, as she calls it, that are marked for your opinion and critique. Awesome class!

Really funny and laid-back. Makes talking about sex not awkward while still adding in jokes. Class felt more like a conversation than a lecture. Material is given real-life contex, often to comedic effect. Exams and assignments are fairly easy. Lots of videos shown to assist lecture. Overall, a pretty easy class made fun and interesting.

Very interesting material. Course materials are useful in real life. Carolyn is fantastic. Clear on what she expects and is willing to explain further. Must attend classes. Textbook is heavily used and examinable so keep up with the reading and you will do fine. Exams are fair. Overall a great teacher.

Carolyn was definitely one of my favorite teachers. She shows a lot of passion for the subject and is extremely knowledgeable, and she shows that cares about the students. The text book is an easy read, so if you just keep up with the readings, you'll do fine.
he is an amazing prof. he made lectures fun and worth while. assignments are just standard and not hard at all. I would recommend this class with him to anyone considering it

His teaching style kept me engaged throughout the entire lecture (despite the lecture being quite long) and made it so I could properly understand the material. Although the course I took with him was memorization heavy, he simplified everything so that it was easy to follow! I would love to take a class with him again!

I need what Milad takes before 3 hour lectures because he's always jumping around and making (non cringey) jokes and enthusiasm to keep things interesting and engaging. He always made it clear what is expected of us and he pulls quite a few questions from iclicker in the midterm and final. One of my favorite courses this semester!

He's so nice, I wanted to cry after my final exam knowing I probably won't be able to take another class with him since I'm not majoring in HSCI. His tests were fair, lectures were entertaining, and is just all around a great and caring prof. Brings in lots of guest speakers to give us different perspectives on topics we've learned in class as well

He's hilarious. The lecture is just under 3 hours, but he keeps the class engaged for sure. Expect lots of jokes, dancing, and performances. He uses iClickers so make sure you show up because it'll take out a chunk of your grade if you don't.

Literally the best prof! He keeps the class engaging for the full 3 hours with so many jokes, dancing and impressions. the hardest part of the course is the midterm but 20% of your grade is from clicker and you don't even need to get the right answer to get the marks. couldn't recommend this course enough!
The best professor
Best HSCI prof. Super enthusiastic and encourages questions. Lectures are content heavy but the exams are SO light.
lectures are fun, he is very caring and always making sure students understand the topic, exams are not supper hard

Milad is the best prof I've had so far, you can tell he's very passionate about teaching. His lectures are very engaging and he also has a great sense of humour which makes the lectures fun. I also found the exams to be fair because he's very open to students' suggestions and provides hints as to what will be on the test.

Favourite Prof by far! He's very engaging and you can get a good grade on exams if you do the work and study. He's very approachable and is always asking questions to make sure you get the most of the course!
Best prof ever.

Dr. Parpouchi is easily the best prof I've ever had. Lectures were extremely entertaining, he has an awesome sense of humour and had the whole class laughing every week. I actually looked forward to his lectures. Exams were fair and he gives lots of hints about what will be on them. Only downsides were lots of reading and he takes attendance.

Requires an insane amount of reading considering there are other courses being taken just not necessary, overall the worst teacher I've had in college. Reads off slides, there's nothing to grab my attention in between all the "uh's" she does every 2nd line.

The content of the class is actually really interesting (it was more entertaining reading the textbook) somehow she managed to make it super boring. No discussion or engagement at all she really doesn't know how to encourage students to talk. Also kinda intimidating. If it wasn't for the class participation mark I think her lectures would be empty.

Prof Puskas was ana amazing prof! Highly recommend her to anyone considering taking this course the course is mainly made up of the two exams and project but if u pay attention in lecture and do the required reading the tests will be very simple and straightforward

I loved Dr. Puskas' lectures, they were always so interesting and well organized. This course is test heavy, and tons of participation marks. My group really screwed me over during a group project to where I ended up doing every bit of the work, and she understood that and I still received a really good grade on it. Amazing prof, humanitarian too.

Cathy cares about her students, and provides plenty of zoom meetings in case there is a touchy topic being covered in class. She just wants her students to be as comfortable as possible. Don't ditch class though, because there are participation marks during her lectures. Exams are based off the slides, not what she covers in lectures
